intro: Paraspalathus acicularis, commonly known as the needleleaf spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its spiny, needle-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. Native to arid and semi-arid regions, this plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. It often grows in rocky soils and is found in regions of southern Africa. The plant contains toxic compounds, making it unpalatable to most herbivores.
